dependencies.description:
Pillow-SIMD is a SIMD-enabled fork of Pillow. It is usually 4-6x faster
than the original Pillow in image processing benchmarks.
dependencies.name: pil

dependencies.description: A specification for pythonic filesystems.
dependencies.name: py-fsspec

dependencies.description: Clean single-source support for Python 3 and 2
dependencies.name: py-future

dependencies.description:
LightningLite enables pure PyTorch users to scale their existing code on
any kind of device while retaining full control over their own loops and
optimization logic.
dependencies.name: py-lightning-lite

dependencies.description: Common Python utilities and GitHub Actions in Lightning Ecosystem
dependencies.name: py-lightning-utilities

dependencies.description: Fundamental package for array computing in Python.
dependencies.name: py-numpy

dependencies.description: Core utilities for Python packages.
dependencies.name: py-packaging

dependencies.description: The PyPA recommended tool for installing Python packages.
dependencies.name: py-pip

dependencies.description:
Protocol buffers are Google's language-neutral, platform-neutral,
extensible mechanism for serializing structured data - think XML, but
smaller, faster, and simpler. You define how you want your data to be
structured once, then you can use special generated source code to
easily write and read your structured data to and from a variety of data
streams and using a variety of languages.
dependencies.name: py-protobuf

dependencies.description:
Simple tooling for marking deprecated functions or classes and re-
routing to the new successors' instance.
dependencies.name: py-pydeprecate

dependencies.description: PyYAML is a YAML parser and emitter for Python.
dependencies.name: py-pyyaml

dependencies.description:
A Python utility that aids in the process of downloading, building,
upgrading, installing, and uninstalling Python packages.
dependencies.name: py-setuptools

dependencies.description:
TensorBoard is a suite of web applications for inspecting and
understanding your TensorFlow runs and graphs.
dependencies.name: py-tensorboard

dependencies.description:
The purpose of this package is to let researchers use a simple interface
to log events within PyTorch (and then show visualization in
tensorboard). This package currently supports logging scalar, image,
audio, histogram, text, embedding, and the route of back-propagation.
dependencies.name: py-tensorboardx

dependencies.description:
Tensors and Dynamic neural networks in Python with strong GPU
acceleration.
dependencies.name: py-torch

dependencies.description: Machine learning metrics for distributed, scalable PyTorch applications.
dependencies.name: py-torchmetrics

dependencies.description: A Fast, Extensible Progress Meter
dependencies.name: py-tqdm

dependencies.description:
The typing_extensions module contains both backports of these changes as
well as experimental types that will eventually be added to the typing
module, such as Protocol (see PEP 544 for details about protocols and
static duck typing).
dependencies.name: py-typing-extensions

dependencies.description: A built-package format for Python.
dependencies.name: py-wheel

dependencies.description: The Python programming language.
dependencies.name: python

dependent_to.description: A deep learning package for self-supervised learning.
